t: For the director of music. To the tune of “Do Not Destroy.” Of David. A miktam. When Saul had sent men to watch David’s house in order to kill him.
Deliver*pn me from my enemies, O God; be*ld my fortress against those who are attacking me.
Deliver*ln me from evildoers and*ld save me from those who are after my blood.
See*pn how they lie in wait for me! Fierce*ld men conspire against me for*ld no offense or sin of mine, Lord.*s
I*ln have done no wrong, yet they are ready to attack me. Arise*ld to help me; look on my plight!
You,*ln Lord*s God Almighty, you*ld who are the God of Israel, rouse*ln yourself to punish all the nations; show*ld no mercy to wicked traitors.
They*pn return at evening, snarling*ld like dogs, and*ld prowl about the city.
See*ln what they spew from their mouths— the*ld words from their lips are sharp as swords, and*ld they think, “Who can hear us?”
But*ln you laugh at them, Lord;*s you*ld scoff at all those nations.
You*pn are my strength, I watch for you; you,*ld God, are my fortress,
my*ld God on whom I can rely. God*pn will go before me and*ld will let me gloat over those who slander me.
But*ln do not kill them, Lord our shield, or*ld my people will forget. In*ln your might uproot them and*ld bring them down.
For*ln the sins of their mouths, for*ld the words of their lips, let*ld them be caught in their pride. For*ln the curses and lies they utter,
consume*ld them in your wrath, consume*ld them till they are no more. Then*ln it will be known to the ends of the earth that*ld God rules over Jacob.
They*pn return at evening, snarling*ld like dogs, and*ld prowl about the city.
They*ln wander about for food and*ld howl if not satisfied.
But*ln I will sing of your strength, in*ld the morning I will sing of your love; for*ln you are my fortress, my*ld refuge in times of trouble.
You*pn are my strength, I sing praise to you; you,*ld God, are my fortress, my*ld God on whom I can rely.
